title: Dr. Jay Koslof
bio:
Dr. Jay A. Koslof is a Licensed Clinical Psychologist with over 25 years of experience treating a wide range of patients across many diagnostic categories, age ranges, and presenting problems. He works with issues of anxiety, depression, trauma, addiction, couples and family problems, as well as providing ADHD evaluations (including Adult ADHD). He draws from psychodynamic, family systems, and cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) perspectives, as appropriate for particular patients and their families.

Dr. Koslof was Phi Beta Kappa at the State University of New York (SUNY) at Buffalo where he received a BA with honors in Psychology in 1976. He received his PsyD in Clinical Psychology from the Massachusetts School of Professional Psychology (MSPP) in 1986. Since that time, he has practiced in psychiatric hospitals, community mental health centers, private outpatient clinics, schools and universities. He also spent 12 years at Harvard Community Health Plan, then a pioneer in managed mental health.

Dr. Koslof sees the relationship between therapist and patient as crucial to healing. His style is to ask questions and to be interactive in the therapeutic process. He attempts to meet patients where they are and to help them to go where they would like to be. He is pleased to join CBTA and is available to provide therapy and evaluations to adults, adolescents, children, couples and families, as well as providing ADHD evaluations across the lifespan and psychological testing.
